To resolve attacks, each figure in a unit that is eligible to attack rolls a D6 against a target number to determine if it inflicts casualties on the opponent. A unit receiving casualties must then succeed in a morale check or rout. Rules are provided to convert troops and heroes from the Original RPG's statistics to Book of War. Magic rules derived from that game are also included.

181498.name: Nothing Personal Expansion Pack #1: Game Designers

120523.description:
The Capo is getting old and about to retire. You think. Maybe it's time for you to make your moves from behind the scenes, to put the gangsters into play that support your goals. Will you gain the most respect?

Nothing Personal is a game for 3-5 players. Players attempt to gain the most respect in five turns (five years) by amassing respect amongst the mafia through influence, negotiation, blackmail and bribery.

Players take turns playing influence cards to take control of gangsters and work them up the chain of power. Each position and gangster has their own special abilities that give players the edge they need to accrue the respect they deserve - to become the Boss of Bosses.
120523.name: Nothing Personal

120524.name: Dinner Date

videogamehonor.32082: 2011 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee

120524.description:
You play as the subconsciousness of Julian Luxemburg, waiting for his date to arrive. You listen in on his thoughts while tapping the table, looking at the clock and eventually reluctantly starting to eat...

„Dinner Date” is the portrait of Julian: from his desires and doubts to reflections on his friends and his place in the world. You are not merely witnessing - by interacting with Julian and his world you gain a clear vantage point on his life.

The wait for the beautiful girl he invited over becomes longer and she becomes the dominant factor in his thoughts. And yet his true problems may not even begin with the girl: what of his work, of his boss, the headhunter, his fascination of Byron and his friendship with Jerry, who had been pushing Julian to take on this date?

In „Dinner Date” you will experience all this: with some drinks, some bread, some soup - and with a clock that slowly mocks the constant wait for when she comes, this elusive girl who will solve everything.

Source: The Developer Website.

120525.name: Comment naissent les bébés?
120525.description:
"How babies are born?" in English

Educational game where players move around the board drawing cards with the associate questions and their answers or to make small tests.
Twelve illustrated plates contain a summary of all the concepts discussed, and the answers to most questions.

120526.name: Anduin (Issue 64 - Sep 2001)
120526.description: This issue contains the adventure "Plug & Play" for Alternity, BESM or other SF RPG. And a Shadowrun adventure for 3 groups "Dreiecksbeziehungen"

120527.name: Kiss My Axe
120527.description:
publisher blurb

Are you ready for some Viking mayhem and adventure? Kiss My Axe: Thirteen Warriors and an Angel of Death is now available in PDF and Print.

Kiss My Axe uses the same underlying system as Sword Noir – the Sword’s Edge System – but it has been altered to provide a greater focus on combat, kind of important for Vikings.

120529.name: Wetten dass..? Junior
120529.description:
Junior version of Wetten Dass ...?

The game offers many simplifications, so just come the youngest in the family and for the course when it comes to the most successful European television show on ZDF.

In five different categories have challenging tasks to be solved to the end to win the game as a competition king.

Players must answer the questions, explain something in 60 seconds with a camera, doing pantomine etc.

120531.name: The Vampire Diaries
120531.description:
The Vampire Diaries is a board game based on the Warner Brothers television show of the same name. Players take on the role of one of four characters from the show, Elena, Stefan, Damon or Bonnie, and begin the game in possession of a photo-frame portraying their character as a human. A switch in the back of the photo-frame can be used to transform the photo into that of a vampire, and the object of the game is to avoid receiving three bite marks, thereby being the last remaining human.

Game play occurs in turns with players moving a dry erase vampire marker/mover around a simple game board. In turn, each player rolls three dice marked with crows and moves the marker/mover zero to three spaces clockwise, depending on the number of crows rolled. The space the marker lands on allows the player to use the top portion of the vampire mover to apply a dry erase vampire bite stamp to another player's photo-frame, erase one of his or her own vampire bites with the supplied dry erase pad, swap photos with another player, or gain control of the Family Crest Ring which protects that player from vampire bites. A roll of zero crows does not move the marker, instead automatically gaining control of the Family Crest Ring for the player who rolled the zero.

When a player receives the third vampire bite on his photo-frame, he can no longer win the game, erase bites, swap photos or possess the Family Crest Ring. However, he can remain in the game, taking turns as normal, but only dealing out vampire bites as allowed. The last player without three vampire bites wins the game.

120532.name: Atlántida
120532.description:
From the back of the book:

Una nave mercante en la que viajáis desaparece más allá de las Columnas de Herakles a causa de una gran tempestad. Cuando el mar vuelve a la calma descubrís con sorpresa que no hay nadie más en la nave. ¿Acaso alguna fuerza oculta ha protegido vuestras vidas? Una colosal nave de guerra os descubre y remolca hasta una gran isla desconocida. ¡Os encontráis en la ATLÁNTIDA, el continente perdido! Los atlantes os reciben con amabilidad, pero hay algo en el ambiente que no os acaba de gustar...
Un mensajero llega al palacio del rey de Atlantis anunciando un gran peligro: los Phrst atacan por tierra y los Sakar y Denen por mar, la ATLÁNTIDA está en peligro y tendréis que tomar partido, pero ¿por quién?

Vive una gran aventura completa de ORÁCULO en el reino perdido de la ATLÁNTIDA, el continente protegido de Poseidón, dios del mar y de todas las criaturas marinas. Conoce los enigmas de una civilización superior y misteriosa. Descubre los secretos de una tierra lejana situada más allá del Océano. Cumple los designios de tu ORÁCULO y avanza hacia la inmortalidad destinada sólo a los grandes héroes.

120533.name: Redstone
120533.description:
Redstone is a Go variant in which red stones are used to capture. The red stones are permanent. They cannot themselves be captured.

As in Go, in Redstone you capture enemy groups by completely surrounding them with your own stones.

The object of Redstone is to annihilate your opponent, eliminating all of his stones from the board.

120534.name: Dust Warfare: Campaign Book "Zverograd"
120534.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Sino-Soviet Union enters Dust Warfare in Campaign Book "Zverograd". This supplement includes a Platoon List with stats and costs for all of the SSU units, background information regarding this faction, and rules for the first Dust Warfare campaign. Moreover, Campaign Book "Zverograd" contains new unit entries for both the Axis and Allies to combat the SSU threat. Field an overwhelming SSU army in Dust Warfare with this tantalizing supplement.

120535.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Cobra and Rattler Medium Walkers – otherwise known as the MCW M3 Expansion – offer the Allies more options for armored support. With its anti-aircraft gun, the Rattler is capable of grounding airborne units. When it is not punishing aircraft, the Rattler unloads a wall of machine gun fire that shreds infantry to pieces. Meanwhile, the Cobra uses its Phaser gun to electrify vehicles and troops alike, causing massive amounts of damage to both. Additionally, this expansion includes parts to give your walker the Amphibious Unit skill.
120535.name: Dust Tactics: MCW M3  Walker – "Rattler / Rattler-Amp / Cobra / Cobra-Amp"

120536.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Many of the soldiers of the SSU are experts with rifles and specialize in harassing enemies from concealed locations. Unlike the Axis and Allies, the SSU prefers to field these snipers in pairs rather than in tandem with a spotter. The SSU Observer Team allows SSU commanders to use the Artillery Strike ability to activate indirect fire weapons. Containing both the SSU Sniper Team and the SSU Observer Team, the SSU Specialists expansion makes a potent addition to your army.
120536.name: Dust Tactics: SSU Specialists – "Nabludatyel / Jnetzi"

120537.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The SSU, like the other factions, goes to battle under the leadership of inspiring and skilled commanders. Heroes like Nikolaï, Yakov, and Red Yana give the SSU forces an edge in combat. Red Yana has an extraordinary Fighting Spirit, and Nikolaï is a superb Pilot. Meanwhile, Yakov is a Legendary Tactician who can adeptly command any strike force. With the SSU Hero Pack, your army has access to new skills and strategies to win any battle.
120537.name: Dust Tactics: SSU Hero Pack – "Nikolaï / Yakov / Red Yana"

120538.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The SSU Rifle Squad is unique in the fact that its members make use of a mix of Sniper Rifles and machine guns to support their Comrades. The soldiers of the SSU are renowned for their skills with rifles, and they prefer to wield these weapons instead of more traditional assault weapons like flamethrowers or heavy machine guns. In fact, Rifle Squads are so skilled with their weapons that it is not uncommon for them to take down enemy walkers!
120538.name: Dust Tactics: SSU Rifle Squad – "Ohotniki"

120539.name: The Hot Lamp
120539.description:
From the introduction:

This is a game for three or four players. Two will be suspects accused of some serious crime, and one or two will be police detectives. It’ll be most fun with two and two. Cut out the cards below and hand them out.

This game operates on the principle of agreement – when someone articulates some fact about the crime, the suspects, or the overall situation, you must accept and build on that fact.

The game ends after twenty minutes or when the detectives are satisfied they’ve got as much as they are going to get out of the suspects.

120540.name: Legends of Kralis
120540.description:
From the RPG description here on RPGGeek:

Legends of Kralis is a high-fantasy RPG that utilizes the Talarius Gaming System. The D100 system is a hybrid partial-success multiple-success system that provides the ease of conflict resolution inherent in a multiple-success system combined with the convenience of not having to roll large numbers of dice.

Legends of Kralis" is filled with sorcery, adventure, intrigue, diplomacy, and exploration. It is a game for those who wish to become something that only exists in the imagination. These include dwarves, elves, gnomes, firbogs, jakara, minotaurs, crusader-slayers, fighters, knights, clerics, monks, jinhuur, thiefs, bards, darkhunters, nadragul, and whatever your imagination can forge into being.

120541.name: Lucid
120541.description:
Subtitle: An RPG Based on the Movie Inception
From "the Setup" section of the rules:
In this game you play highly illegal con men who steal information from unsuspecting people while they, and you, sleep. Using a briefcase sized technological device and specially made chemicals you and your teammates will sedate, without his knowledge, The Mark. The Architect will create up to three layers of dreams that the team will have control over in every way except for the people who populate it. The Mark will believe that The Dream is his own unless he is convinced otherwise and will generally not understand that he is even dreaming. As The Dream becomes less and less stable The Mark might start to realize that this is not his dream and if he has had proper training he might be able to turn the tables on the team.

120542.name: Gesund gewinnt
120542.description:
Objective: know as many questions as possible out of health
care
- acting by turn -
promotional edition (Bristol-Myers-Squibb)
draw cards, move your meeple as fast as you can answering multiple choice questions correctly

120543.name: The Middle Age
120543.description:
From the RPG description here on RPGGeek:
Welcome to the Middle Age. This book is your portal to another time and place. It is your guide to a world of chivalry, warfare, intrigue, and suspense. It is your doorway to a land where feudal lords are in a constant struggle for power. A land where men are judged by their skill at arms and even the most valiant of knights die young. Included is everything you need to play: Sample characters, a powerful magic system, detailed equipment and weapons, monsters, historical background and Maps.

rpg.2273: Slaine: The Roleplaying Game of Celtic Heroes

120544.name: Libro de Tribu Volumen 2: Los Falianos - Los Finianos
120544.description: Spanish version of Sláine Tribe Books: The Falians and Sláine Tribe Books: The Finians.

rpg.2273: Slaine: The Roleplaying Game of Celtic Heroes

120545.name: Libro de Tribu Volumen 1: El Dominio del Abeto - Los Sessair
120545.description: Spanish version of Sláine Tribe Books: The Sessair and Sláine Tribe Books: The Fir Domain.

120547.name: War and Peace
120547.description:
War and Peace is a game that allows players to recreate the fight for Europe from 1805 to 1815. The game is designed for play by two players, one player being the French player and the other player is the British. Each player also controls one of the major countries of France, Britain, Austria, Russia, or Spain. Prussia is also in the game but starts neutral. The countries of France, Britain, Russia, Austria, Prussia, and Spain are represented by infantry, artillery, cavalry, naval units. The countries of France and Britain are at war throughout the game. The countries of Russia, Austria, Prussia, and Spain become neutral, conquered neutrals, French allies, or British allies through the use of diplomatic resources or military conquest.

France starts out strong militarily with the aid of the Spanish navy and a strong French army. Austria and Russia, when united, have strong armies while England rules the waves and buys influence and allies. Victory is determined by the conquest of France or Britain, or causing the isolation of Britain through political and economic means. The fate of Europe rests in your hands...

120548.name: Diamino poker
120548.description:
Like a Poker Dice, but there are letters on dice.
Player rolls dice and may choose to reroll two times some of the dice.
Each letter is worth certain number of points.
If player forms a word he adds up the values of the letters.
Player with the most points for his word wins.

120549.name: Mensch ärgere Dich nicht mal anders
120549.description: LUDO - A BIT DIFFERENT! In this game the figures are moved around the board using four dice instead of one. Thereby it is required that two dice should always be paired with one another. The board is very small - only 24 fields to get your pawn into your house.

120550.name: Bagdad Tank Invasion
120550.description:
User Summary

Bagdad (sic) Tank Invasion is a browser game available on newgrounds.com and elsewhere on the web. The game asks the player to use his tank platoon to secure a landing zone for the Delta Force to enter Baghdad and take out an enemy facility. In a manner somewhat similar to Conflict on the NES, the player is faced with various tactical dilemmas, such as whether or not to fight an Iraqi recon patrol and whether or not to press into the city. Battle is automatically resolved, being predetermined and depending on the decision that you made. If the Delta Force manages to destroy the facility, then you win. The game was released by October 2002, before the outbreak of the Second Gulf War, thus making it mildly prophetic.

The screenname of the individual who designed the game is HOODLUMinc and he has created two other games in a similar vein.

120551.name: SpielxPress (Issue 15 - Jun/Jul 2008)
120551.description: This issue contains a obit of Ernest Gary Gygax, an article about Sex in Live- Roleplay and more articles about Sci-Fi games, RPG items and LARP

120552.name: Aces Hearts Deluxe
120552.description:
"The best-selling Aces® line brings the classic game of Hearts to iOS.

"Shoot the Moon" with this classic card game that is popular around the world. Aces Hearts brings the timeless game to iPhone with some extra flare. Play characters like Elouise, Vladimir, and Drucilla. Don't remember how to play or need a refresher? We put in step by step tutorials and 5 levels of difficulty to make Aces Hearts easy and fun for everyone!

Fun characters, smooth animations, and great game play make this a card game that you'll enjoy playing over and over on your iPhone.

Game Features:
10 fun characters to play against
Game Center Leaderboards and Achievements
Step by step tutorial
In-game turn advisor
5 difficulty levels
Many options to customize
Turn animations off for quick play
Special Shoot the Moon and winning animations
Optional Jack of Diamonds for positive points"

Source: The Developer Website.

120553.name: Adventure Ball (Physics Game)
120553.description:
User Summary

Adventure Ball is a physic puzzle game with cartoonish graphics, your goal is to get the ball to the bulls eye. To do that you control the angle and power of the initial push and also you have to build powerups in route to change the ball behavior.

This game offers more than 80 challenging levels in a realistic physical simulation.

120554.name: Current
120554.description:
"Current is an action match game with 56 levels of fast-paced gameplay driven by an original soundtrack. The objective appears simple: gather enemy Hexog and shoot them back into others of the same type. But beware, new enemies prowl the Current and this mission will rapidly test your mettle. Good luck, ARC Pilot.

Game Features Include:
- 56 levels of unlockable gameplay
- Dynamic enemies with unique AI
- Procedurally generated levels ensure never the same game twice
- Turn-based mode (Alternate moves with Hexog)
- Variable difficulty setting
- Original 7-song soundtrack playable in-app and available on iTunes."

Source: The Developer Website.

120555.name: Fjör til enda
120555.description:
From the back of the box: Fjör til enda is a fun, varied game where players travel around the world and have exciting adventures and all kinds of troubles. Players can win a trip with a private jet to South America, ride a bike, train, taxi or stay for a visit at the North Pole. Everybody is active the whole time and anything can happen.

The player who is the first one to get six continent cards (one for each continent) wins the game. Players roll two dice and move accordingly on the map. They can use the Forward/Not cards to add/subtract from their rolls. Luck/Bad luck cards are as the name implies good or bad for the one who draws them. Continent cards are the object of the game, players have to roll a die and depending on the number, perform some action to win that card.

120556.name: Monopoly: Konstanz
120556.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Konstanz, in Germany.

120557.name: Monopoly: Limburg
120557.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Limburg, in Germany.

120558.name: Monopoly: Marburg
120558.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Marburg, in Germany.

120559.name: Monopoly: Memmingen
120559.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Memmingen, in Germany.

120560.name: Fótboltaspilið
120560.description: From the publisher: A football (soccer) trivia game with 1800 questions in six categories. Those categories are: The English football, the Icelandic football, the European football, the National teams, On the field and 1 X 2. This game is for everyone who watches football, young and old. Up to six players or teams can play this game.

120561.name: Veiðirím
120561.description: From the publisher: Veiðirím is a new game aimed at children four to eight years old who are learning to read. The game is also useful for children who have trouble learning to read and also for children learning Icelandic. Veiðirím is a memory game with nouns and adjectives that rhyme, which players learn to read by seeing the pictures.

120562.name: Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket-Powered Battle-Cars
120562.description:
The game is played by one or more players, local or online, using their controller to hit a football, which is much larger than the cars themselves, into the opposing goal. Each goal gets one point, and whoever has the most points when the timer runs out wins. If both teams are tied when the timer runs out, it goes into sudden death over-time mode, where whoever gets a point first wins. The overtime game mode can theoretically last forever. There are also many various mini games and tournaments.

Source: Wikipedia, "Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket-Powered Battle-Cars", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120563.name: Player's Guide to Secrets of Pact Magic
120563.description:
From Author Note:

This twenty-six page guide is for use with Secrets of Pact Magic. The guide provides an overview of pact magic, a typical spirit, character concepts, and quick summaries of pact magic races, classes, feats, prestige classes, minor magic items, and organizations. Although you will find 1st through 4th-level progressions for various classes, Secrets of Pact Magic is necessary to actually create a character.

120564.name: Villains of Pact Magic: The Exorcist Cleric
120564.description:
From Designer Note:

Just as most clerics battle undead, the exorcist cleric battles malevolent ghosts, possessing fiends, and binders of spirits. The exorcist cleric is a standard cleric but with spontaneous casting as described in Unearthed Arcana by Wizards of the Coast, a swap of turn/rebuke undead for exorcism- related abilities, less armor, more class skills, and preset domains.

120565.name: Actual Assassins
120565.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody might like Magical Trevor, but they don't all like magical Assassins.

For those who prefer their killers to be less magical and more knowledgable, those who understand that even people who are 'good' will kill for the greater good or whatever cause they tie their flag to, for those believe that skill is more important than magical gifts, this is for you.

A modified Assassin prestige class.
Justifications for every alignment - Even the good may kill for their cause.
Death Trance - A complete focus on the kill.
Alignment Masking - Mental training can mask your nature, even from magic.
Unafraid to Die - The most successful Assassins must be unafraid to die.
Soul Destruction - Helps prevent pesky resurrections by mutilating the body.

120566.name: Battlemage: The Power of Evocation
120566.description:
From Introduction:

Within this e-book you are going to discover new spells all of which are from the evocation school of magic. With these spells are also new magic items that can be utilized in your campaign. The prestige class Battlemage is present as it is the main reason this book exists. The information here in is meant to be used as you, the gamemaster, sees fit. You may mix and match or even modify what is presented here for your game purposes, but the main issue is to have fun using this book.

120567.name: The International Protection Agency
120567.description:
From publisher blurb:

You have just been recruited to one of the most secretive and powerful agencies in the world! Your mission is simple: seek out, investigate and deal with all paranormal happenings on earth and even near space. The International Protection Agency is a mini-campaign setting using the d20 system giving you everything you need to carry out a campaign in a modern setting. New gadgets,monsters,villians and character classes for I.P.A. agents are in this e-book along with a host of background material, equipment and pictures.

120568.name: Lances & Larceny
120568.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lances & Larceny is a dramatic adventure combining elements of espionage and subterfuge with a healthy dose of hack and slash and is written with a party of four 1st-level characters in mind, but can be scaled to fit parties of larger size or higher level by adjusting the individual encounter levels presented. It is recommended that due to the large amount of combats in a relatively short span of time that the party contains a healer of some sort, but if there is not a healer present, the GM may allow the player characters to get a bargain at the local temple on healing potions, etc. In addition, the overall challenge of the module may be lowered further by removing some of the combats, or allowing the party to by-pass them, as some are optional.

120569.name: Word Fun
120569.description:
Box Back

Learning and play are wrapped up in one. The alphabet comes to life. Choose from 3 action packed games. Once letters pop on the screen, there's action a-plenty. Monkeys scamper through the jungle carrying letters on their tails. And it's fun to try new words when vowels rocket to the sky. Beyond the laughter and excitement, that words can actually be fun!

120570.name: Immortal Cities: Nile Online
120570.description:
Like many browser games, there is no set goal. The game is played on an infinite-round basis—there are no resets planned. The main focus of the game is on trading resources in order to progress a player's Palace level or increase the amount of cities he or she has. There is a player versus player aspect that allows players to gain control of "monuments" from either an AI force or other players.

Part of a discussion about Nile Online, during an interview with Tilted Mill's President, Chris Beatrice, by gamersetwatch.com: "A lot of different goals came together with Nile Online. First we wanted to see if we could make a much simpler, much more accessible and less demanding game that still provided a lot of the city building experience, and also looked really great".

Source: Wikipedia, "Immortal Cities: Nile Online", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Immortal Cities: Nile Online is a persistent browser-based empire building game set in Ancient Egypt. Play with thousands of other players as you construct cities and monuments worthy of your legacy as Pharaoh! Nile Online is casually paced; it's something you can play throughout the day, minutes at a time.

There is nothing to download or install - within seconds you're commanding, tweaking and growing your empire from anywhere that you have access to the internet.

Source: The Game Website.

120571.name: Worm Whomper
120571.description:
User Summary

Protect your corn field from various pests which move across the screen.

120572.name: Pinball (1983 / Intellivision)
120572.description:
Back of Box

This is it! The sounds, skills, hits & misses of the all-time arcade favorite. There are three screens, each with different playing set-ups. You'll work your way up - if you're a sharp enough shooter. INTELLIVISION® Pinball has bumpers, flippers and targets - even a "tilt" feature! Bonus points for the big winners!

120573.name: Mind Strike
120573.description:
Back of Box

A mind jolter that can be played slow, using alternating turns, or fast, with both players simultaneously hooked to the ultimate goal of conquering each other's CASTLE! Playing it slow, it's called "Mind Strike" and requires quite a bit of strategic thinking. Playing it fast, it's called "Speed Strike" and it's a dazzler that blends action with strategy!
Choose up to 50 playing boards or design your own. Program the computer opponent's skill level (to your or his advantage). Engage in tantalizing confrontations! Combine your pieces for greater strength or split them apart to move farther! Make it as wild or absorbing as your mind allows it to be!

120574.name: Reversi (Intellivision)
120574.description:
User Summary

Traditional board game Reversi, with three board sizes (8x8, 6x6 and 10x10) with a game clock. Two player or one player against an AI.

120575.name: Checkers (Intellivision)
120575.description:
User Summary

Traditional Checkers, two players or vs AI. Computer allowed to give hints for moves.

120576.name: Resident Evil Deck Building Game: Hunk Foil Promo
120576.description:
Foil promo card for Hunk.
Health: 70
Level 1: When Hunk would take any Damage, you can give that Damage to your Partner insted.
Level 2: At the begining of your turn, if Hunk has no Partner, you get +2 Cards.

120577.name: Safehouses
120577.description:
From the publisher:

Hiding from the Heat

If it hasn't happened to you yet, it will. A run will go south. People will be looking for you. Their eyes will be everywhere—your home, your friends' houses, the places you hang out, even the spots where you buy your soykaf. They're looking for you, waiting for you, and when they find you, they're not going to talk. It'll be a single shot, or a flash of sharp steel, and you'll be done.

To avoid this, you need to lay low. You need a place where no one will look for you, and where you'll have enough of life's basics to get you by. Don't know where to find such a place? You're in luck, chummer—we've got the guide for you. Whether your acquiring and stocking your own bolt hole or engaging professional safehouse managers, we've got the info you need to live to fight another day.

Safehouses is a supplement for Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition that provides both flavor text and rules to help runners acquire or find the hideouts they need to stay out of harm's way. It includes sample safehouses, equipment suggestions for the well-stocked hideaway, and safehouse creation rules that work with the Advanced Lifestyles rules from Runner's Companion. Get Safehouses, stay safe, and be ready to charge back into the shadows once the trouble you're in has blown over.

120578.name: War of Ashes: Shieldwall
120578.description:
War of Ashes: Shieldwall is the latest offering from the designers of This Quar’s War and Songs of our Ancestors. Concentrating on command and position instead of unit statistics and abilities, WoA: Shieldwall provides simple rules that bring with them difficult decisions.

Taking the gritty tactics and concepts of the Dark Ages and setting them in the whimsical world of Agaptus, WoA: Shieldwall begins with the Roar Phase in which both sides rally their line and taunt their opponent. The goal of which is generating Froth, a resource used throughout the game to bend the rules and adjust position in the line.

To represent the flowing nature and chaos of the battlefield, WoA: Shieldwall utilizes a blind random activation system in which the commander never quite knows how far he can push his fighters before the momentum of the battle passes to his opponent.

Once two lines have met, the fighting begins. Unlike most ranked unit games, casualties are removed from the point of contact and the lines begin to merge. Each slain opponent brings with him a decision – advance and break their line, or hold and preserve your Shieldwall!

120579.name: Spuzzle
120579.description:
In Spuzzle, you must be the first to finish your five puzzle projects!

Each player chooses a project on the board and the puzzle set corresponding to that project's color. Then, each player prepares the twenty puzzle pieces (five sets of four pieces), each representing an animal.

To play, each player draws a card from the deck. If the picture is an animal, the player places on his project one of the pieces corresponding to the animal. If the card is the monkey, the player removes one piece of his choice from one of his project's incomplete puzzles. If the card is a Spuzzle card, all players play a piece on the animal of their choice in their project. The first player to finish all five of his puzzles wins!

120580.description:
From Hasbro's web site:

"Brace yourself for search-and-destroy battle intensity as you compete with the enemy to keep your ships afloat. Play peg cards and power cards to find, hit and sink your opponent’s fleet of five ships. Each ship has a special power! Choose from beginner or advanced rules for edge-of-your seat excitement.Includes 24 coordinate cards, 52 destruction cards, 4 reference cards and instructions."

Game play:

To begin, each player shuffles and places their twelve Coordinate cards facedown in a 3x4 grid. They then draw five cards from their Destruction Card deck. Players take turns playing one card, then re-drawing up to five cards in hand.

Players can play the following cards:

1) white peg cards to search for ships in the other player's grid;

2) red peg cards (of variable strength) that damage revealed ships;

3) Power cards that have variable abilities.

In addition, revealed ships guide their players additional powers, allowing for rule-bending changes to the game.

The first player to eliminate all five of their opponent's ships wins!


The game from 2014 is now part of the Shuffle series of games and now simply called Battleship.
120580.name: Battleship: Hidden Threat

120581.name: The Sages Must be Crazy: Spells of Inebriation
120581.description:
Raise a mug and give a cheer for Spells of Inebriation.

For St. Patrick’s Day, your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications are proud to give you The Sages Must Be Crazy: Spells of Inebriation. This product covers the unusual and often chaotic spells of those spellcasters that love strong drink. This product contains eleven spells based around a theme of alcohol. From the simple Bless Ale to the devastating Hammered, these spells are designed to both put a smile on your face and give you a collection of new tricks.

It’s time to lighten up your world a little because the sages must be crazy.

Product includes two versions - one with a parchment background and one in black and white, for easy printing.

[Publisher Blurb]

120582.name: Have Some Pie
120582.description:
It's time for some pie, but be careful or the joke’s on you.

For April Fools' Day, your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications are proud to give you the latest rant from Ebenezer Killjoy with The Sages Must Be Crazy: Have Some Pie. This treatise targets that favorite device of the jester - the pie and all the magic spells and items that have been invented around it. In its pages you will find a collection of 8 spells that deal with baking and pies and 13 magical and alchemical pies, including 9 pie weapons.

It’s time to lighten up your world a little because the sages must be crazy.

Product includes two versions - one with a parchment background and one in black and white, for easy printing.

[Publisher Blurb]

120583.name: Let Them Eat Cake
120583.description:
Have a slice of cake, but be careful, or the joke's on you!

For April Fools' Day, your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications are proud to give you the latest rant from Ebenezer Killjoy with The Sages Must Be Crazy: Let Them Eat Cake. This treatise again targets those that would corrupt the art of baking with more tasty magic spells and items of an edible bent. In its pages you will find a collection of 5 spells that deal with baking, pies and cake as well as 12 magical and alchemical baked goods.

It's time to lighten up your world a little because the sages must be crazy.

Product includes two versions - one with a parchment background and one in black and white, for easy printing.

[Publisher Blurb]

120584.name: Tricky Treats
120584.description:
Be careful this All Hallows' Eve or there may be more tricks than treats.

For Halloween, your friends here at Healing Fireball Publications are proud to give you the latest rant from Ebenezer Killjoy with The Sages Must Be Crazy: Tricky Treats. This treatise targets those that would corrupt the art of candy making and take advantage of the traditions of Halloween, all for their own amusement. This book contains magic spells and items of a sweet bent. In its pages you will find a collection of 7 spells that deal with candy and the effects of eating too many sweets as well as 10 magical and alchemical candies.

It's time to lighten up your world a little because the sages must be crazy.
Product includes two versions - one with a parchment background and one in black and white, for easy printing.

[Publisher Blurb]

120585.name: Trick
120585.description:
A few days after sending Ebenezer's last rant, which was entitled Tricky Treats, off to publishing, the Healer came in to find an addendum from Ebenezer 'The Dry' Killjoy on his desk. The addendum contained two new treats that Ebenezer in his wisdom judged to be a perversion of magic.

Free 7-page product given away as a Halloween bonus on the Healing Fireball webpage.

[Publisher Blurb]

120586.name: Treat
120586.description:
This special free Halloween 'Curious Items' presents two unique items that give your world a sweet little treat that pack a punch.

Free 6-page product given away on Halloween on the Healing Fireball webpage.

[Publisher Blurb]

120587.name: A Squire's Guide to All Things Knightly
120587.description:
By my Code!

Do you plan on running a game of knights and honor? Want to play a knight in your upcoming campaign? Then A Squire’s Guide to All Things Knightly is the book for you. Inside you will find 24 pages of knightly facts, from an exhaustive list of the different noble titles to the different parts of a knight’s armor to a discussion of the knightly code of honor with many classic examples. Add to that a huge 34-page role playing appendix with advice on how to play a myriad of classic knight types in several different campaign styles from high fantasy to science fiction, plus a collection of useful universal record sheets, and you have a guide that is a truly useful reference to all things knightly.

The Squire’s guide was originally produced as a children's teaching tool for the New Jersey Renaissance Kingdom.

It has been considerably expanded to become more adult in tone, although it is still an in-character guide to the knightly life. The appendix takes this information and applies it to many aspects of role playing a knight and provides appropriate record sheets. ZIP file contains both a book fold and on-screen version of the Guide (48 half-pages/24 full pages) and the Appendix (68 half-pages/34 full pages).

[Publisher Blurb]

120588.name: Dear Esther

videogamehonor.37556: 2012 AzPlay Awards Most Original Game Idea Winner

120588.description:
“A deserted island… a lost man… memories of a fatal crash… a book written by a dying explorer.”

Dear Esther is a ghost story, told using first-person gaming technologies. Rather than traditional game-play the focus here is on exploration, uncovering the mystery of the island, of who you are and why you are here. Fragments of story are randomly uncovered when exploring the various locations of the island, making every each journey a unique experience.

Forget the normal rules of play; if nothing seems real here, it’s because it may just be all a delusion. What is the significance of the aerial – What happened on the motorway – is the island real or imagined – who is Esther and why has she chosen to summon you here? The answers are out there, on the lost beach and the tunnels under the island. Or then again, they may just not be, after all…

Source: The Developer Website.

120589.name: Beleman (Issue 4 - May 2005)
120589.description:
This issue contains the 4 ingame regional isues:


Havena Fanfare
Andergastische Freie Trommel
Nostrische Postille
Thorwal-Standarte


all with editiorial Gamemaster tricks and tips for regional scenarios and background infos.

120590.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 51 - May 2003)
120590.description: This issue contains the adventure "Für eine Handvoll Kakaobohnen" and an article about endurance of non-human races.

120591.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 52 - Dec 2003)
120591.description: This issue conatains the adventure "Mord von Gottes Gnaden", and an article about the new skill "cooking"

120592.name: Monopoly: Neubrandenburg
120592.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Neubrandenburg, in Germany.

120593.name: Monopoly: Osnabrück
120593.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Osnabrück, in Germany.

120594.name: Monopoly: Ostfriesland
120594.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Ostfriesland, in Germany.

120595.name: Monopoly: Potsdam
120595.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Potsdam, in Germany.

120596.name: Veils of Verdandi
120596.description:
'Veils of Verdandi' is a fantasy board game in which players work together to complete a heroic quest.The game has been created with the aim of translating the excitement of interactive storytelling of role-playing games to board games, while simplifying existing game concepts as well as adding new ones.

In the game, players must rescue the nephew of the king, prince Ture, from the dangers and mysteries of the Dark Forest. To do this, the players move across the game board as an adventuring party and visit strange and magical places while battling vicious enemies. But the players must move quickly, for when day changes to night, the Dark Forest becomes much more deadly indeed.

Used in this game are 4, 6 and 8 sided dice for combat and movement across the board, as well as for specific interactive story challenges the game has to offer. Players may buy new equipment and magical items during the game, and train their special abilities to a higher level.

The game is the first in a saga, the next installment of the game, Veils of Verdandi Book II, will carry the story beyond the Dark Forest and into a vast and deadly mountain range, and Slavic mythology. Players will be able to carry over any equipment and skills acquired in the first installment, and use them to defeat such dire foes as the Vampire, the Werewolf, and other dark and dreadful creatures born of mist and moonlight, that will challenge the might and magic of even the hardiest of adventurers.

120597.name: Anduin (Issue 65 - Oct 2001)

rpgissuearticle.155855: Die Abenteuer von Bruno dem Banditen

120597.description: This issue contains the shadowrun adventure "Jagd auf einen Roboter" and one universal adventure "Quest- Die Suche"

120598.name: Défifoo Classic
120598.description:
In each round, two teams compete and the third is the referee! Then the roles change. Mime, design, action, speed, memory, address: 150 simple and fun challenges in every genre: Find 10 objects of specific color in the room as soon as possible! Make more sports guessing mimicking! and many more.

Quickest team scores. Team who has most points and the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:

One bag,
cards 150,
hourglass,
two notepad,
2 pencils,
1 die,




rules of the game

120599.name: Robinson Crusoe
120599.description:
Game from New Zealand, probably from the 1950's.

A simple roll and move game. Try to land on the green squares and avoid the red squares. If either colour is landed on, you must follow the instructions, good or bad.

First to get the hero from his home to being rescued, wins.

120600.description: K2: Lawina (K2: The Avalanche), a small expansion for K2, contains four new weather tiles describing bad weather conditions and there is an additional icon showing when the avalanche is coming down. All climbers who are not hidden in their tents that day have to move one space further from the mountain peak.

boardgameversion.154231: Polish Świat Gier Planszowych Magazine edition

120600.name: K2: The Avalanche

120601.name: Masters of Jade
120601.description:
From the back of the book:

Merchant princes and trader kings, masters of jade and emperor thieves; salesmen born with the trick of selling fire to the gods; genius tacticians and profiteers, hailed by the Fair Folk for their treachery; the Guild is the greatest roll of mortal merchants the world has ever known. For seven centuries the Guild has dealt in coins, chains, spells, and souls, confounding even the might of the Realm—what will it buy and sell to secure its survival in the Time of Tumult? Will the Exalted become its partners, its masters, or its pawns?

This book includes:

An examination of the Guild by Direction, from the mammoth caravans of the North to the great merchant fleets of the West.
Details of the Guild’s commerce with the supernatural, from the hungry Fair Folk to the restless ghosts of the Timeless Order of Manacle and Coin.
The Creation-Ruling Mandate, a new system for telling large-scale stories of economics, empire, and warfare.

120602.name: Vessel
120602.description:
With M. ARKWRIGHT’S invention of the liquid automaton FLURO, civilization as we know it has been TRANSFORMED.

Not an industry is left that does not employ FLURO WORKERS in its operations. Their work is FLAWLESS, their efforts TIRELESS, and in the event of industrial accident, their forms REPLACEABLE.
Through use of the M Arkwright’s patented TURBINE invention, Fluro creation is UNRESTRAINED, flexible enough to bring ANIMATION to absolutely ANY LIQUID. The INFINITE ADAPTABILITY of these life-like machines makes them a force greater even than NATURE HERSELF.

With the phenomenal success of this invention, ALL EYES are upon M. Arkwright as he prepares his next great invention, a BUILDING-SIZED creation of UNKNOWN PURPOSE, known only as THE ACCELERATOR.
JOIN US as we venture into this new age of LIMITLESS WONDER and POSSIBILITY, and enter the world of VESSEL.

Source: The Developer Website.

120603.name: NASCAR 2001
120603.description:
NASCAR 2001 is the first from EA Sports' NASCAR series to be released for the PlayStation 2 on November 7, 2000. The game was not released to the Xbox. NASCAR 2001 was the fourth game in the NASCAR series.

NASCAR 2001 was the final game that featured Dale Earnhardt as a regular full-time driver, prior to his death in the 2001 Daytona 500 (which would reappear in NASCAR Sim Racing with his 1999 car and in NASCAR 07 as an unlockable Chase Plate and Earnhardt appears in NASCAR Thunder 2003 as result of a cheat code). Johnny Benson is also absent in this game, while it was the first NASCAR game to include Jimmy Spencer And Elliott Sadler. The drivers Michael Waltrip, Kenny Irwin Jr., Richard Petty and Adam Petty do not participate in any of the races as a computer opponent, instead the player must be the driver.

Source: Wikipedia, "NASCAR 2001", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120604.name: NASCAR Thunder 2002

videogamehonor.29698: 2001 D.I.C.E. Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee (Console)

120604.description:
NASCAR Thunder 2002 is the fifth game in the NASCAR series of video games, and is the first of the series to have a new title (the other games simply read "NASCAR" and then the year). Notably, it is the first NASCAR game to feature alternate paint schemes on the cars. It featured the 2001 NASCAR Winston Cup Champion Jeff Gordon on its cover and 2000 NASCAR Winston Cup Champion Bobby Labonte on the disc. The theme song for the game is Sweet Home Alabama by Lynyrd Skynyrd.

NASCAR Thunder 2002 was the first NASCAR game released for the Xbox and the second released for the PlayStation 2. Game modes consist of Create-a-car, Quick race, Season mode, Career mode, and practice. Before every race, the player has the option to qualify for a position at the start of the race, get to know the track in practice, or 'race' other cars in Happy Hour. The game has 35 drivers from the 2001 Winston Cup season (minus Dale Earnhardt due to his death, but the game has many tributes to him including a black #3 screen on start-up) and several then-Busch Series and fantasy drivers that can be unlocked.

The PlayStation 1 edition was separate from the rest, and included an instant-replay feature, fantasy tracks, and only 36 drivers per race. A system of power-up/cheat cards and challenges, similar to Chase Cards and Lightning/Dodge Challenges in later editions, was a major game mode in this version.

Source: Wikipedia, "NASCAR Thunder 2002", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120605.description:
Moloch forces are heading toward New York to raze the city. This will end the resistance of the people and eventually break their defense lines. A swarm of steel-gray machines marches to the east, destroying everything in its path. Day after day, the horizon is decorated with new pillars of smoke. Fire will soon visit the place that used to be called New York.

Unless soldiers from the Outpost army can stop this convoy of machines. The fate of New York is in their hands. Can they destroy all the Moloch machines before they reach the city? Can they slow down the convoy in a series of ambushes and small battles? They have to...

Neuroshima: Convoy, first published as The Convoy, is an asymmetric two-player card game set in the post-apocalyptic world of Neuroshima. One player commands the convoy of powerful robots, and his goal is to reach New York and turn it into ashes. The player has a deck of 35 cards: robots of Moloch (such as the Gauss Cannon, Clown, or Juggernaut), modules to attach to the robots (Network module, Kasparov module), and special cards (such as Push back, or Move). He plays those cards in the cities he passes while moving toward NY, trying to turn human settlements into dust while preparing for the final battle.

The other player commands the Outpost troops, attacking the convoy and trying to slow it down. The Outpost deck also contains 35 cards: soldiers (such as Runner or HG), buildings (such as Bunker or EMP Cannon), and many special cards (Move, Retreat, Medic). The Outpost has to win a few battles, slow down the march of Moloch as much as possible, and prepare to welcome robots in New York City.
120605.name: Neuroshima: Convoy

120606.description:
The game is played in 5 rounds for which the number of cards per player changes each time (7,8,9,8,7).

Each player bets on the number of tricks that he hoped to get.
There are 5 colors with the numbers 1 to 9 and knight, king, executioner (0 or 10 depending on the player's choice), dragon and the witch who are are stronger (except in the last 3 turn or they are worthless).

The first player commits a color, the others should play the same color and bigger card to take the trick.
At the end of the game everyone counts the number of tricks performed. if the bet is won, the player multiplies the "tricks" by two and adds it to his 100 points. If the bet is not won it calculates and subtracts the difference to his score.
Player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
120606.name: Défifoo Marron

120607.name: NASCAR Thunder 2004

videogamehonor.30916: 2003 Spike Best Driving Game of the Year Winner

120607.description:
NASCAR Thunder 2004 features the 2002 champion Tony Stewart on the cover with a scowling look to represent the new Grudges and Alliances feature. It was the only game as of 2002 to feature the previous Winston Cup (Sprint) Cup Champion on the cover. The game had the most extensive soundtrack of the series up from four songs from the previous game.

Source: Wikipedia, "NASCAR Thunder 2004", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120608.name: Nemesis The Warlock
120608.description:
User Summary

A computer game adaptation of the 2000AD comic Nemesis the Warlock.

The player controls Nemesis and must clear each of the 30 1-screen levels of enemy terminators. Nemesis starts the game with a sword and a rifle without ammunition. Bullets can be collected from fallen enemies. Each level must be cleared before the timer runs out, and Torquemada (Nemesis' arch-enemy) will periodically reanimate enemies and turn them into zombies.

120609.name: NASCAR 2005: Chase for the Cup

videogamehonor.30934: 2004 Spike Best Driving Game of the Year Nominee

120609.description:
NASCAR 2005: Chase for the Cup is the eighth installment of the EA Sports' NASCAR video game series. NASCAR 2005 is the first game in the series to drop the word Thunder from the title since NASCAR 2001. Kevin Harvick, driver of the #29 GM Goodwrench Chevy Monte Carlo, appeared on the cover. It also marks the first time the original PlayStation has been excluded from the NASCAR lineup. This was the first NASCAR edition to be released exclusively on six generation home consoles.

Unlike previous entries, which would normally add a few extra features but leave most of the game identical to its predecessor, the game brought massive change to the series. One example is the inclusion of NASCAR series other than the NEXTEL Cup Series; the National Series (Busch Series), the Craftsman Truck Series, and the Featherlite Modified Series, plus muscle cars. More examples include the implementation of NASCAR's new Chase for the Cup points system, and Fight to the Top mode, where you control a custom driver throughout his career starting in the lower series and working up the ladder (similar to NASCAR: Dirt to Daytona). Another change is the absence of the cockpit view and the absence of makes and models in the Truck series, all of which appear to be Ford F-150s. This was the last NASCAR game released for the Nintendo GameCube.

While a large number of real drivers are present in the NEXTEL Cup Series, Busch Series, and Craftsman Truck Series in NASCAR 2005: Chase for the Cup, fantasy drivers are still present, sponsored by fictional or unused sponsors. However, the Whelen Modified Tour is entirely made up of Fantasy drivers. Dale Earnhardt is the only legend in the game and can be unlocked by buying his Thunder Plate or via cheat code or choosing him as favorite driver.

Lightning Challenge mode includes challenges of moments that happened in NASCAR from 2003 and the 1st part of 2004. Michael Waltrip, driver of the #15 NAPA Chevrolet, returns as the commentator for all the challenges except for two, Kevin Harvick does the challenges that involve Michael being the driver in the challenge. These challenges are played on all difficulty levels. The player must beat a number of challenges at that difficulty level before going to the next difficulty level.

Source: Wikipedia, "NASCAR 2005: Chase for the Cup", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120610.name: NASCAR 07
120610.description:
NASCAR 07 is the tenth installment of the EA Sports' NASCAR video game series. This was the last NASCAR edition to be released exclusively on sixth generation consoles.

The NTSC game cover features Elliott Sadler, driver of the #38 M&M's Ford Fusion. The PAL region game cover features Matt Kenseth's #17 DeWalt Power Tools Ford Fusion. This game is the first since NASCAR 2001 not to include a subtitle in the name. The game retains the teammate features introduced in NASCAR 06: Total Team Control, but does not add any major gameplay changes. However, the graphics include a blurring effect to attempt to give a better sense of high speed, and the pace of the gameplay has been sped up considerably. This is also the second EA Sports NASCAR video game to appear on a handheld system (first NASCAR 2000 for Game Boy Color). On the PlayStation Portable, the game is simply called NASCAR.

Source: Wikipedia, "NASCAR 07", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120611.name: Reise in's Märchenland
120611.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (100)
- moving by turn -
roll the die (1d6) & move forward; ending on an occupied space: meeple is going to be replaced; ending on a marked space: follow instructions glued on cover inside
remarks: published ~ early 1950's in the GDR

120612.name: NASCAR 09
120612.description:
NASCAR 09 is the twelfth installment in the EA Sports NASCAR series, it is the sequel to 2007 game NASCAR 08. Through the career mode, "Chase for the NASCAR Sprint Cup", Gordon leads a mentoring program, a new feature offered in NASCAR 09. This is also the third EA Sports NASCAR video game to appear on a handheld system for Mobile phone version.

In October 2007, Electronic Arts moved the PlayStation 2 game development to a new studio in North Carolina to be able to get better information with the NASCAR teams in an attempt to improve the game. The PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 versions of the game were still made at the old studio. Due to the development team using certain resources to work on key features in the game, no car manufacturers were present in this title.

Jeff Gordon mentors the player in the new "Chase for the NASCAR Sprint Cup" career mode that has a completely revamped 3D menu interface. With Jeff's help, the player signs contracts, builds their reputation, and earns performance points by winning in the NASCAR Whelen Modified Tour (PlayStation 2 only), NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series, the NASCAR Nationwide Series, and the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series. One new feature in NASCAR 09 is "Own The Track". This allows the player to compete against friends or other gamers and own all 22 tracks in the Sprint Cup Series. Also new is the new "Sprint Driver Challenge", in which the player complete challenges in all sorts of situations to earn rep and performance points. In the game there are two driving styles available for the player to choose from: Normal and Pro. The Pro driving style is more suited for experienced players, while the Normal mode is better suited for beginners.

To date, this is the last NASCAR game to be produced by EA, and the last NASCAR game for the PlayStation 2, after suffering from slumping sales, the difficulty of installing new features, and the lack of popularity. In 2009, NASCAR Kart Racing was released, replacing any 2009 installment for the annual series. It may be EA's last game before their exclusive license with NASCAR expires. Yet the door to NASCAR games for the PlayStation 2 has been shut, as Polyphony Digital's Gran Turismo 5 was not featured for the sixth-generation console.

For game players in Canada, while the game was still released only in English, the instruction manual and box cover were bilingual, with text in both English and French.

Source: Wikipedia, "NASCAR 09", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120613.name: NBA Live 2005
120613.description:
NBA Live 2005 is the 2004 installment of the NBA Live video games series. The cover features Carmelo Anthony of the Denver Nuggets.

NEW FEATURES:

EA Sports Freestyle Air. This mode allows the game player to become an offensive force with new style dunks, user controlled tip-ins, and more.

NBA All-Star Weekend. This mode allows the game player to play in the NBA All-Star Weekend, year-after-year, in Dynasty mode or go right to the Weekend in features on the main menu page. NBA All-Star Weekend includes the Rookie vs Sophomore game, the NBA All-Star game, the Slam Dunk competition and the 3 point competition.

Create-A-Player. In this mode, gamers can create their own player and can customize the looks, shoes, and the college attended of the fictitious created player.

Source: Wikipedia, "NBA Live 2005", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

120614.description:
Defifoo purple is a trick taking game that takes place in five innings. The object of the game and scoring conditions vary in each round by drawing card "challenges". The goal is to lose the fewest possible points after five rounds.

There are cards with five colors numbered 1 to 10 corresponding to five planets, some joker cards with two-colors that can change the planet and a Sun card.

At the beginning of the round the challenge-card is drawn what shows the scoring for that round.
Players play the cards following a suit. At the end of the turn, one that played the highest card wins the trick.

Each player starts the game with 1000 points. At the end of each round, we proceed to the number of points depending on the challenge of the round. The player who lost the least points after five rounds is the winner!

Contents:

64 cards,
a score book,
a little pencil,
a velvet bag
120614.name: Défifoo violet

120615.description:
The game is a sort of fusion between hold'em and scrabble. In each round, players must form the longest words possible by combining the cards in their hand and those on the table. Card system "challenges" imposes additional conditions on each spin: requirement to use a letter, the fastest wins, the longest word wins the cards etc.

If the deck is exhausted, the game ends when a player has got rid of all your cards, or that nobody can play anymore.

The scoring:
• Each card is worth 1 point earned.
• The one who got rid of all your cards double their points.
• The other players take off their total as many points as cards remaining in their hand. The player with the most points is declared the "winner!"
120615.name: Défifoo Vert

120616.name: Wer trägt das Risiko
120616.description:
Objective: become the wealthiest player after one year
- acting by turn/shuffle the pile of event cards -

make up your mind what kind of insurances for your company you have to acquire;
draw top event card from the pile and follow instructions ( for you or other/all players);
if you draw the card '31 Dec.' game is ending:
overinsured? You paid to many insurance contributions...
underinsured? You paid too much compensation for your bad luck...

120617.name: Chronicles of Skin

rpghonor.23177: 2011 Indie RPG Award - Most Innovative Game - Runner-Up

120617.description:
Chronicles of Skin is a game of scribbling and storytelling. Using cards and a pencil, you and your friends will tell a story, recording it on paper with doodles and glyphs. In your pack you will receive:

* 72 full colour playing cards
* One 36 page, full colour rules booklet
* One double-sided skin sheet

In every game you will be an Artist, an Other and a Scribe. As an Artist you will doodle the events of your story.

As an Other you will create characters for the story and guide them to their fate.

As a Scribe you will invent locations and set up the world at war.

When play begins, you interpret symbols and create flags using a custom deck of 72 gorgeous playing cards. From these flags you determine the traits that sculpt the story of your war. You will introduce characters from both cultures and bring them to the brink of extinction. Which cultures survives? That's up to you.

* Players: 3-5
* Duration: 90 mins or 3 hours (two game modes)
* Ages: 14+

120618.description:
Mille Bornes at full speed with only 66 cards instead of 110!

Fewer cards in hand and rules arranged for parts more rhythmic and faster!

Players compete to drive 1000 km, dealing with hazards along the way. Draw a card to your hand, play or discard. You must lay a green traffic light to start, play cards showing mileage, dump hazards (flat tire, speed limit) on the other players, remedy hazards (spare tire, end of limit) from yourself, play safety cards (puncture proof), and try to be the first to clock up the distance.
120618.name: 1000 Bornes Express

120619.name: An Introduction to Amberdale
120619.description:
From publisher blurb:

A FREE d20 System adventure module for level 1 characters. Help get the Town of Amberdale ready for an annual festival, and introduce the players to the World of Gwent.

120620.name: Something Askew in Amberdale
120620.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Annual Night Market has brought many strange faces to Amberdale, and not all are there on respectable business. Why are orcs and goblins allowed to trade freely in town? Just how many things are Askew in Amberdale? And how many more will be if these questions aren't answered quickly? A mystery for 1st-2nd level characters. Can be played alone or as the first module in the three-part "Amberdale Series."

120621.name: One Orc, Two Orc, Red Orc, Blue Orc

rpgissuearticle.75796: Press Release: Amberdale 2: One Orc, Two Orc, Red Orc, Blue Orc

120621.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Annual Night Market has ended, but many strange men remain in town. Two Orcish armies are on the march to Amberdale, and the back-up troops requested by Lord Amberford have not arrived yet. What happened to the missing army? Can it be found in time? And will the extra forces be enough? Maybe more important is this question: what do the orcs want with the small town of Amberdale? This forest adventure / dungeon crawl, for 2nd-3rd level characters, can be played alone or as the second module of the three-part "Amberdale Series."

120622.name: Super 1000 Bornes électronique
120622.description:
Like in Mille Bornes the goal is to be the first to reach the 1000 miles with some new attack cards included.

This game includes also electronique game console who decides attacking.

players compete to drive 1000 km, dealing with hazards along the way. Draw a card to your hand, play or discard. You must lay a green traffic light to start, play cards showing mileage, dump hazards (flat tire, speed limit) on the other players, remedy hazards (spare tire, end of limit) from yourself, play safety cards (puncture proof), and try to be the first to clock up the distance.

120623.name: Guilds and Societies of Gwent
120623.description:
From publisher blurb:

Below are descriptions of all of the major guilds and societies you will encounter in the World of Gwent. These groups don’t necessarily make a character more physically powerful, but they do establish contacts that work to make them more socially powerful. They are all quite different, but they all have three things in common: joining requirements, benefits, and a secret handshake or gesture (be creative with that).

120624.description:
The goal is to photograph wildlife in safari earning 250 points.

In his turn player may play the cards with animals to photograph them, attack the opponents playing the cards with floods, swarm of mosquitoes etc. or defence against attacks by playing cards like canoe, a mosquito net etc.

Player who scores 250 points first is the winner.
120624.name: Safari flash

120625.name: Magestry Player's Rulebook
120625.description:
From Introduction:

Magestry is a live action role-playing game that takes place on and in the imaginary world of Magesta. Its lands are very similar to those of planet Earth, but it is a more fantastical setting. Magesta possesses many of the elements from classic fantasy literature (elves, goblins, magic, etc.), but there are also many elements unique to the Dabbleverse.

Magestry has a system of rules that is different from that of any other live action role-playing game. It has been designed to give the player ultimate flexibility in building and playing his or her character; however, we hope that each player will be more focused on having fun and on role-playing well than on character advancement. For the enjoyment of all the players of Magestry, we are interested in the personalities, backgrounds, and ambitions of each character on Magesta. You don’t have to have the most powerful character to have the most fun.

120626.name: Professions & Prestige
120626.description:
From Introduction:

The Profession skill on the Miscellaneous skill chart in the Magestry Player’s Rulebook may not look like much more than a single skill, but in this chapter you will learn about the many options that it opens to your character.

The Profession skill by itself provides your character money. An Apprentice earns 3 silver pieces per event, a journeyman earns 10 silver pieces (1 gold crown) per event, and a master earns 20 silver pieces (2 gold crowns) per event. This money represents your character’s business between events and will be received at check-in of the next event that character attends. You will only receive one event worth of payment for each game you play.

Your character is allowed hold multiple professions, but he must advance through the ranks in each of them separately, and no matter how many he holds, he will not receive more than 4 gold crowns per event at check-in.

120630.name: J't'p'tan

rpgseries.8338: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement

120630.description:
From the Introduction

J’t’p’tan, known to most simply as Doornik-628E, is an unspoiled little world in the heart of the Koornacht Cluster, near the systems claimed by the xenophobic Yevetha.

In the last years of the Republic, many systems in the Koornacht Cluster were formally opened for settlement; H’kig pilgrims fleeing a doctrinal conflict on Rishi claimed Doornik-628E. The acolytes called the yellowish globe J’t’p’tan. There, they settled in a sheltered valley and quarried stone for the Temple of the Infinite Spirit, a sprawling complex intended as a physical tribute to the mystical essence. For decades, the H’kig considered themselves safely removed from the unholy forces at work in the larger galaxy. But if the H’kig were finished with the galaxy, the galaxy wasn’t finished with them.

User Comment

J’t’p’tan is a planetary Web Enhancement for Coruscant and the Core Worlds

120631.name: Wir gehen einkaufen
120631.description:
Objective: collect most of those goods (12) placed on the board
learn the foods needed in the kitchen
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' game
roll the die & move forward; ending on a card space collect it if available; game ends if all cards are taken.
remarks:
published ~ mid 50's in the GDR

120632.name: Galactic Gazetteer Hoth and the Greater Javin

rpgseries.8338: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement

120632.description:
From the Introduction

Hoth. Bespin. Key worlds in galactic affairs, they nonetheless reside in a relatively backwater region of space, known collectively as the Greater Javin. Long a haven for smugglers, pirates, and those looking to avoid any entanglements (Imperial or otherwise), this region boasts scores of exacting locations, is home to a number of sentient species, and offers worlds of every clime for the ready traveler.

You’re about to explore a region of space that runs the gamut from Echo Base’s frozen corridors to Darlyn Boda’s seedy alleys to the secluded Anoat System (where there’s more than a certain princess thought). Welcome to the Greater Javin!

User Comment

Galactic Gazetteer Hoth and the Greater Javin is a Web Enhancement for Star Wars (WotC Revised Edition).

120634.name: Fighter Duel
120634.description:
Back of Box

Jump in the cockpit of the most authentic WWII fighter simulator ever created for the PC!

Fly one of 13 classic World War II dogfighters in pulse-pounding battles. With ultra-accurate full-force flight modeling, you'll know exactly how it feels to pilot a real WWII warbird. Even rookies can leap right into the fray with the Quick Flight mode.

Face up to eight computer enemies in seven realistic tactical scenarios or fly against a human opponent via modem. Experience the ultimate in PC graphics as you scan the skies with multiple cockpit views, camera angles covering 360 degrees and a photorealistic, fully-functional instrument panel.

Get ready for non-stop, high-flying warfare!


Developed by Jaeger Software, critically acclaimed creators of dogfight simulations



Graphic superiority assured; highest average frame rate among all PC flight simulators running in 256-color, 640x480 texture-mapped, high-resolution SVGA



Two-player modem duels with easy-to-use interface



Supports popular joysticks and other peripherals, such as rudder pedals and throttle controls



Planes include the P-51D Mustang, ME-109E, G and K, FW-190 and 4 British Spitfires.

120635.name: Hero's Guide Web Enhancement: Character Templates and Prestige Classes

rpgseries.8338: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement

120635.description:
From the Introduction

While most characters fall under the descriptions provided by most classes and species, some have a special quality about them that sets them apart from normal sentient beings. These changes, which differentiate a character from even other members of his species, can be illustrated through the use of a template.

A template is a set of changes made to a standard character to make that character reflect those differences more accurately in game terms. The character continues to use all statistics and special abilities from his existing class, except as noted in the text of the template.

User Comment

Character Templates and Prestige Classes is a Web Enhancement for Hero's Guide.

120636.name: Hero's Guide Web Enhancement: Commerce and the Shadow Wing

rpgseries.8338: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement

120636.description:
From the Introduction

What exactly do smugglers smuggle? What do freighters haul? The Star Wars universe is full of commercial shipping, and there’s no reason the heroes shouldn’t be able to get in on that action—especially if they have a ship. Though buying, transporting, and selling cargoes should not be a major consideration of any Star Wars Roleplaying Game campaign, players may occasionally want to know what cargoes are available for sale or transport, or what they find in the holds of ships they may investigate.

User Comment

Commerce and the Shadow Wing is a Web Enhancement for Hero's Guide.

120637.name: Hero's Guide Web Enhancement: Lightsaber Forms and the Fallanassi

rpgseries.8338: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement

120637.description:
From the Introduction

Though the seven lightsaber forms discussed in the Hero’s Guide are the most commonly accepted fighting styles, a few other styles exist that are considered fringe and are not formally recognized as full-fledged forms.

User Comment

Lightsaber Forms and the Fallanassi is a Web Enhancement for Hero's Guide.

120638.name: SpielxPress (Issue 16 - Aug/Sep 2008)
120638.description: This issue contains an overview of new D&D products including the 4th edition, it contains also an interview with Peter Taylor (shadowrun author)

120639.name: Quick Starfields

rpgseries.8338: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement

120639.description:
From the Introduction

Not all space is void. Interesting settings can harbor intriguing encounters while journeying aboard a starship, approaching or leaving a destination, or evading foes. Heroes can use astrographical formations to their benefit. In Attack of the Clones, Jango Fett flies Slave I into an asteroid field to evade Obi-Wan Kenobi in his Jedi starfighter, deploying concussion mines to further hinder pursuit. Han Solo attempts to lose Imperial forces in the asteroid field near Hoth in The Empire Strikes Back.
